text: Helcystogramma flavilineolella is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Ponomarenko in 1998. It is found in south-eastern Siberia and China (Henan, Liaoning, Shaanxi, Sichuan, Zhejiang). The wingspan is 13–16 mm. The forewings are greyish brown, with the costal margin, from the base to three-fourths of its length, and veins light yellow, without spots. The hindwings are brownish grey, darker towards the apex. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1998 flavilineolella Category:Moths of Asia
title: Helcystogramma flavilineolella
